hevs.gdx2d.components.physics

Class PhysicsPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • hevs.gdx2d.lib.physics.AbstractPhysicsObject
      • hevs.gdx2d.components.physics.PhysicsPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BodyInterface

    public class PhysicsPolygon
extends AbstractPhysicsObject
    A physical shape which collides as a polygon, see AbstractPhysicsObject.

    Note: all dimensions and positions are in pixels.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pierre-Andr√© Mudry (mui)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsPolygon

        public PhysicsPolygon(java.lang.String name,
              Vector2[] vertices,
              float density,
              float restitution,
              float friction,
              boolean dynamic)
        Create a physics polygon.
        Parameters:
        name - An optional name for the object (for debug)
        vertices - The polygon vertices
        density - The density of the object, in kg/ms2
        restitution - The restitution factor (energy given back on collision). 1 means all the energy is restituted, 0 means no energy is given back
        friction - The friction factor (between 0 and 1)

      • PhysicsPolygon

        public PhysicsPolygon(java.lang.String name,
              Vector2[] vertices,
              boolean dynamic)
        Create a physics polygon.
        Parameters:
        name - An optional name for the object (for debug)
        vertices - The polygon vertices
        dynamic - Static or dynamic body

    • Method Detail

      • getPolygon

        public Polygon getPolygon()
        Returns:
        The current polygon shape, the one which is simulated
